Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; from top: part of dotted rosette in added white and red and group of five white verticals; two white and one red band; white and red dotted rosette and white and red lotus bud; two white and one red band; exterior: five brown bands.
Curator's comments: The decoration on both sides of the sherd is consistent with both the Mature Animal Style and the Grand Style. For parallels regarding the interior decoration, see British Museum 1888,0601.513, and for the exterior decoration see Lemos no. 795 from Aegina.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0666) (phase 2)
